results.title: Martha Clarke: light and dark
results.brief_description: The film portrays an artist’s imaginative sources, and the processes through which she creates an evening of theatrical dance. The film departs from traditional dance films by looking behind the finished performance to its imaginative sources and the process by which the performance grows.

results.title: Martha
results.creator_credit: Peter Marthesheimer and Rainer Werner Fassbinder
results.brief_description: After Martha Heyer’s tyrannical father dies suddenly during their holiday in Italy, she meets and is proposed to by engineer Helmut Salomon, who sweeps her off her feet with a disturbing mixture of romance and intimidation. After their marriage Helmut’s behaviour becomes increasingly oppressive and Martha’s ever more fearful and desperate to please, as the film builds to a truly horrific climax. Whether taken as a psychological horror movie or as the blackest of black comedies, this is undoubtedly the most extreme and alarming of all of Fassbinder’s visions of married life. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Marsupials: Naturally the numbat
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, John Shaw and David Bairstow
results.brief_description: You mean a wombat don’t you? is the usual reaction but a numbat is quite different - smaller than a cat, with a long pointed nose and a striped back. Numbats live inside hollow logs in densely wooded areas, and eat termites. Includes feeding scenes and close-ups of young numbats.

results.title: Marshland birds I and II: island builders and shore builders
results.brief_description: A study of many British mainland birds - coots, swans, geese, great-crested grebes, snipe, bittern, moorhens, yellow wagtails, bearded tits, reed warblers, and harriers. Their mating, nesting and the hatching and rearing of their young are studied in detail. These birds represent two main types of marshland birds: island builders, and shore builders, according to where they build their nests.

results.title: Mars minus myth
results.brief_description: One of the scientists of the Mariner 9 mission presents some of the geological findings of this mission to Mars. Photographs sent back have stripped away much of the myth surrounding the planet, while raising new questions. Discusses the origins of landforms, the discovery of water ice in the polar caps, the improbability of life and other topics.

results.title: Mars attacks the world
results.creator_credit: Filmcraft Production, Barney A Sarecky, Ford Beebe and Robert F Hill
results.brief_description: Based on Alex Raymond’s newspaper feature “Flash Gordon” and the serial “Flash Gordon’s trip to Mars”, this condensed version of the serial provides a fascinating historical look into the sci-fi films of the past, minus all the special effects and computer animation of today’s blockbuster sci-fi films. The story revolves around the universal theme of good vs evil, of enemy planets trying to destroy Earth. When strange unexplained phenomena start occuring on Earth, Flash Gordon (Larry “Buster” Crabbe), Dr Zarkov (Frank Shannon) and Dale Arden (Jean Rogers) jump to the rescue and take a space flight to Mars, crash-landing in the Valley of Desolation. There Flash runs into his old enemy Ming the Merciless of Planet Mongo, and Ming’s ally, Queen Azura of Mars, whose attempts to destroy Earth with a deadly ray are eventually thwarted by Flash and his companions with the help of The Clay King and his Clay Men. Flash, Dale and Dr Zarkov return to Earth to a hero’s welcome, ticker-tape parade and all. Cast also includes Charles Middleton, Beatrice Roberts, Donald Kerr, Richard Alexander. NB: “Due to unique material contained herein, fluctuations may occur in picture and sound quality.”

results.title: Married life (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Part One of the series “The Family of Man”’ which sets out to compare family life in five different locations around the world. In a comparison of marriages, with men and women sometimes having several partners, this program sets out to discover what, if anything, these marriages have in common. Husbands and wives, shown going about their daily lives are interviewed.

results.brief_description: A naturalistic approach to experimental film making. The filmmakers have taken one script and interpreted it in four different ways.

results.title: Marrickville
results.creator_credit: Jotz Productions, Russ Hermann and Tom Zubrycki
results.brief_description: The inner-city Sydney suburb of Marrickville is the most ethnically diverse locality in Australia. The suburb’s heavy industry goes back to the mid-19th century and successive generations of migrants have settled and worked in the area. The video celebrates the contribution of Greeks, Yugoslavs and Turks to Sydney, from the post-WWII years to the present, as well as looking at the experiences of more recent migrants from war-torn Lebanon and Vietnam. Through the poetry and prose of migrant Australians and that of their children we hear of the cultural dislocation experienced by residents of Marrickville.

results.title: Marriage is a partnership
results.brief_description: An analysis of some of the problems which arise during the first year of marriage. Outlines adjustments by the married couple to learn to live together: Feeling and acting as a couple rather than as individuals; learning to accept and fulfil new roles, adjusting differences in background; recognizing and accepting personality differences; perceiving and caring for the needs of one another; adjustment to become a member of a new family group; recognising one’s own parents are also in-laws; assuming responsibility in financial matters and in the management of the home.
